comments.message: I just searched on google for - ppe ebola cooling - , congratulations, your proposal is the first in the list!
ha, that's nuts! Hard be first in anything on google! Cool. Thanks for letting me know

Hi Anthony, I also thought about cooling the health care workers from outside. I do not know whether a shower works, again because virus particle may be drawn to places where they are not wanted. So personally I would prefer a solution where the head is not wetted. But to have a method to cool the workers down, before the PPE has to be removed, would be good.
Thanks Rainer.  I really appreciate the input. Valid points. I wonder is there a work around.

description: Simple and cheap is what I'm aiming for.
summary: Cooled decontamination shower for use with overhead full length PPE gear (pictured) to cool and disinfect medical staff.Pros: Cheap, easily transportable, reuses already short supplies and provides out of the way places with disposable decon chambers.  Bleach/agent can be chilled so it acts as a cooling down system also.  Step in - cool down, decontaminate. Cons : Possible vapors in enclosed space. Advice and input most welcome, Ideo is after all a group project.  Please point out any flaws, upgrades, questions or proposed modifications in the comments below
title: Cooled PPE Decontamination Shower
